description: Enterprise techniques used by Exaramel for Linux, ATT&CK software S0401 v1.1
name: Exaramel for Linux (S0401)

techniques.comment: [Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401) uses HTTPS for C2 communications.(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
[Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401) has a command to execute a shell command on the system.(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
[Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401) has a hardcoded location under systemd that it uses to achieve persistence if it is running as root.(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
[Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401) has a command to download a file from a remote server.(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
[Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401) uses RC4 for encrypting the configuration.(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
[Exaramel for Linux](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0401) uses crontab for persistence if it does not have root privileges.(Citation: ESET TeleBots Oct 2018)
